column3: Do you run your node from home?
column4: If no or partial, what is the reason?
column5: Do you track your node bandwidth usage?
column6: What do you use to track your node bandwidth usage?
column7: Would increased bandwidth usage have an adverse effect on your ability to run a node from home?
column8: What are your internet download speeds?
column9: What are your internet upload speeds?
column10: Do you have an overall data ceiling / cap?

column6: I don’t have any speed problems on the whole network, so it’s not something I pay attention to
On the CLI I use vnstat and overall for the network I use monitoring on the router

column4: Rant: While I can manage an increase in bandwidth requirements, I stake ETH, not because it is the token which will get the bigest return, or the largest gas throughput, but because it is the network in which, as long as the gas is paid, everyone's transactions go through. And until we get Inclusion Lists working, the only way to mantain that censorship resistants is to foster Home Stakers, anywhere they are (and with the bandwidth they can get)
Both bandwidth concerns and realibility (lots of internet downtime due to provider).  I have to run server with throttled upload (1.5Mbps) or video conference is not possible on same connection.

All of the above. While it would have been the choice of preference to be at home solo staker, it was prohibitively complicated to run testnet and had not good experience with EthStaker and Dappnode advice and support to feel confidence on running at home.

column6: Although I do not track currently, I will track because of the recent discussions about increasing blob number. I will use one of these tools: https://snapshooter.com/learn/check-network-usage--linux

column4: I travel a lot for work and prefer to rely on a cloud server.
